156.title: Inside Ramadan
156.plot: This July, the Islamic calendar tells us that it's ninth month, Ramadan, is here to test and encourage Muslims around the world to participate in a 30-day fast. Watch us this week to find out how they do it and why.

157.title: Latin America News
157.plot: We take you back to the Dominican Republic, Guatemala and Honduras, where Tzu Chi, throughout the years has built deep and rooted relationships with many communities in need.

158.title: Journey to Hualien (Part I): Beyond Jing Si Soap
158.plot: Many of you might have heard of Jing Si products or already use them. But do you know what's behind these products ,where they come from, who makes them, and why?

159.title: Journey to Hualien (Part II): No Work, No Meal
159.plot: "No work, no meal" is their motto. Let's see how the Dharma Masters start at 3:30 AM everyday to make this a reality.

160.title: Passion: The Road to One Day
160.plot: Even with no experience when they first began disaster relief back in 1994, let's see exactly what's kept Tzu Chi going 20 years strong.

161.title: At Home in Dallas
161.plot: This week we traveled to Dallas, Texas to visit Tzu Chi's Central Regional Office. Join us as we sample vegetarian delights, tour the current campus, and explore the Dallas Mayor's Back to School Fair.

162.title: Tzu Chi Gives Back
162.plot: This week, we follow some of the most successful Tzu Chi charity programs across the US. From socks to scholarships, let's see how volunteers are working hard to make a difference for those who are down and out on their luck.

163.title: Honduran Dreams
163.plot: In 2011, 14 different floods affected Monjaras, Honduras. The Tzu Chi Foundation rebuilt houses but also hope for many families. Now, see how they've embraced the philosophy of giving.

164.title: Taking Action at the UN
164.plot: You last saw us here at this year's CSW, but this time, we're here for the 65th Annual UN DPI-NGO Conference.

165.title: Out of the Fire
165.plot: Follow the journey of two courageous victims who lost their homes in the 2003 Cedar Fire, and how their lives intersected with the Buddhist Tzu Chi Foundation.

166.title: Tzu Chi Beyond the Classroom
166.plot: As the 20th year anniversary of Tzu Chi's Education Foundation approaches, let's take a look at how it's broadening the minds and spirits of students both young and young at heart.

167.title: Haitian Dreams
167.plot: This week, explore Haiti from a different perspective. See a young student with big ambitions, a mother fighting for the lives of her children, and how a few grains of rice can be signs of hope.

168.title: The Climate Movement
168.plot: Join 360 this week as we take you through Climate Week 2014, where the globe's most passionate citizens will fight for a greener world and more sustainable future. Keep watching to see who's taking a stand!

169.title: 25th Anniversary Concert - Part I
169.plot: This week, we take you to Tzu Chi USA's 25th anniversary charity concert in LA, where you will see a variety of performances including a special guest from Taiwan, Wakin Chau.

170.title: 25th Anniversary Concert - Part II
170.plot: This week, internationally renowned singer Wakin Chau puts on a charity concert for Tzu Chi in Los Angeles and San Jose, while Tzu Chi volunteers perform an original play inspired by Master Cheng Yen's Jing-Si Aphorisms.

171.title: Jing Si Rice in Supermarkets
171.plot: This week, follow USTC 360 Host, Nils Aucante, to Northern California to see how Tzu Chi volunteers have promoted Jing Si Rice in supermarkets and how local foodies have responded.

172.title: TC USA 25th Anniversary
172.plot: As part of Tzu Chi's 25th anniversary celebration, this week we are following two Dharma masters from Taiwan's Jing Si Abode as they attend the Anniversary Camp in San Dimas and visit Tzu Chi chapters around the U.S.

173.title: NY Charity Concert Part I
173.plot: This week, Tzu Chi's Northeastern Region is kicking off a concert tour to celebrate Tzu Chi USA's 25th Anniversary in New York's historic Riverside Church.

1.title: Chillan, Where the Sun Is Sitting
1.plot: Welcome to US Tzu Chi 360, where we share the latest stories of what Tzu Chi volunteers are doing to serve, and connect with the global community.

37.title: Food Pantry in Cedar Grove
37.plot: Our feature today brings us to New Jersey, where Tzu Chi volunteers have been holding the Food Pantry program in cooperation with the New Jersey Food Bank.

38.title: The Happy Campus' Impact in SF
38.plot: Today we continue our feature on Tzu Chi's Happy Campus program in San Francisco.

39.title: Flood Relief in Honduras
39.plot: Today we visit Honduras. Aside from being one of the poorest countries in the Western Hemisphere, Honduras has also been plagued with corruption and high crime.

40.title: Haiti's First Buddhist Catholic School
40.plot: Today we bring you updates on Tzu Chi's reconstruction efforts in Haiti since the devastating 2010 earthquake.

41.title: Haiti's Nursery of Hope
41.plot: Today, we return to Haiti to follow-up on the progress of Tzu Chi's Moringa tree-planting project.

42.title: Continuing Education
42.plot: Our feature today brings us to Tzu Chi's Continuing Education Center in San Dimas, California. The center offers a variety of extra-curricular workshops for adults, which is great for people who want to learn a new skill.

43.title: A Homeless Story : Cavity on the Street
43.plot: Our feature today focuses on a less publicized national health issue: America's broken dental care system.

44.title: A Life Long Charity
44.plot: Today we focus on one the cornerstones of Tzu Chi - the mission of charity.

45.title: Milestones of the Happy Campus Program in SF
45.plot: Today we follow up on Tzu Chi's Happy Campus program in San Francisco. Over the past six years, our volunteers have realized that there isn't a one size that fits all models since every child's learning style is different.

46.title: Food in Our Backyard
46.plot: Today's feature is on one of my favorite topics, food, or better yet, local farming -- a matter that deserves much attention.

47.title: Urban Homestead
47.plot: Today we continue with our special on local farming.

48.title: New Life, Then & Now - Haitian Orphans
48.plot: Today, we're out of the studio and we're very fortunate to come across a wonderful person who has been a big part of our Haiti feature. Without him, these children today wouldn't be here, especially in Pittsburgh.

49.title: Recycling Volunteers in Cerritos
49.plot: Today's feature is a big salute to all the dedicated recycling volunteers and environmental activists around the world.

50.title: The Toothless Man
50.plot: Today we revisit America's dental care system.

51.title: The Journey of the Tzu Chi Bike Group
51.plot: Our feature today focuses on ways we can improve our lifestyles which is healthy for us and the earth.

52.title: The Big Green Apple
52.plot: Today, we continue with our feature on ways we can reduce our impact on the planet, such as biking.

53.title: La Joya, a Peaceful Battle in the Drug War
53.plot: Ever since Mexico's former President Felipe Calderón declared a war on drugs in 2006, over 50,000 lives has been claimed because of drug related violence. With time, the war only gets more brutal and out of control.

54.title: Jimmy Wu's Story, Part 1: Writing for Redemption
54.plot: How does a juvenile get incarcerated for 13 years in prison? How does he strengthen himself for survival? How does he purify his mind? After being released, join us as Jimmy re-establishes his life, one step at a time.

55.title: Sustainable Green Living in NYC
55.plot: Sustainable green living isn't only a lifestyle choice in New York City, it's a movement of many individuals who use their time and resources to provide organic vegetables to people and help support animal rights.

56.title: Rio+20: Sustainable Development and Our Future
56.plot: Tzu Chi visits Brazil's Rio de Janeiro where the Rio+20 is taking place.

57.title: Hawaiian Sunset
57.plot: Hawaii is considered one of the most beautiful and happiest places in the United States, but even paradise requires much needed assistance.

58.title: Katrina, Seven Years Later: Stories of Resiliency
58.plot: Hurricane Katrina wreaked havoc on New Orleans but she failed to undermine the people's faith- and lessons were learned.

59.title: 7 Years After Katrina: The Rising of New Orleans
59.plot: New Orleans is known for its cuisine, cultural festivals and the birthplace of Jazz. Join us in the second part to USTC360's special feature to commemorate the 7th Anniversary of Hurricane Katrina.

60.title: Nurture and Cherish Mexico
60.plot: Hoping to change current situations in Mexico, Tzu Chi sent a medical team not only to treat the patients in need, but also to establish a long term medical system.

61.title: Jimmy's Story Part II: Families Are Like Quilts
61.plot: During the 13 and half years Jimmy spent in prison, there was another group of special people who was his pillar of support- Jimmy's family.

62.title: Tzu Chi Couple: Dr. Fan & Stephanie
62.plot: The Hawaiian Tzu Chi Volunteers celebrate their 16th Anniversary with lasting laughs and sentimental tears.

63.title: Behind the Scenes at Haiti's College Mary Anne Construction
63.plot: Nearly two and a half years later, Tzu Chi has remained and gained a permanent local presence in the Haitian community.

64.title: Rio+20: Youth Empowered
64.plot: It's been 20 years since the original UN Earth Summit on sustainability development, and many would argue that not much has changed.

65.title: Honduras Caught in the Crossfire
65.plot: Honduras is considered to be one of the most dangerous countries in the world. Despite this, many of these people are trying to do something good to help the country and its inhabitants.

66.title: Haiti: The Recycling Movement
66.plot: After the 2010 earthquake, millions of plastic bottles were clogging Haiti's canals and saturating the streets of Port-Au-Prince.

67.title: Jimmy Wu's Story, Part III: Lock Up! Wake Up!
67.plot: What's life like in Juvenile Hall? How does one make a child valuable, despite being in prison for the rest of his life? Jimmy remembers when he was 16 years old, something happened, something transcendent - wake up.

68.title: Tzu Ching Unite: The Future of the Tzu Chi Foundation
68.plot: As the current Tzu Chi generation slowly grows older though, there becomes a greater need to rely on youth. But are they ready and willing to take on this responsibility?

69.title: Haiti Hot Meals Service
69.plot: It's been almost three years after the earthquake. Let's go see how Tzu Chi has remained actively committed to help the country and the people recover day-by-day.

70.title: Sandy Aftermath
70.plot: Right after Super Storm Sandy, the Tzu Chi Volunteers from the East Coast have been providing many different kinds of help in both New Jersey and New York.

71.title: Sandy Two Weeks Later
71.plot: Follow us in NY, where Tzu Chi has organized emergency cash cards distributions in record time while everywhere in the United States, the Tzu Chi Chapters are fundraising to contribute to the efforts.

72.title: A Big Gift from Tzu Chi After Sandy
72.plot: Three weeks after Sandy made landfall, Tzu Chi volunteers are still providing assistance in the most affected areas, where some residents feel forgotten.

73.title: Starting Over After Superstorm Sandy
73.plot: Almost a month after Superstorm Sandy, families now have to rebuild their houses and their lives. They have to start over. To help them Tzu Chi's assistance, care and love is most welcome.

74.title: Seeds of Change in Santa Ana
74.plot: Orange County contains the wealthy cities of Anaheim and Irvine but also several neighborhoods in Santa Ana of families living in extreme poverty.

75.title: Solutions for Food Waste in America
75.plot: Americans today are wasting 40% of their food. Uneaten food accounts for second largest component of landfill. Join us in this episode as we scour the streets of New York City to find ways to reduce and recover quality, fresh food.

76.title: Sandy Aftermath: The Long Road to Recovery
76.plot: The road to recovery seems so long to those who had lost their homes, but they know they are not fighting alone with the helps of the people of their own communities and other organizations.

77.title: San DieGo Green
77.plot: Unlike the traditional tours, we will also take you behind the scenes to explore the beauty of how a city co-exists with Mother Nature.

78.title: 3 Years After the Quake: Ongoing Challenges in Haiti
78.plot: 3 years after the earthquake, the Haitian people are still in the process of rebuilding their life.

79.title: 3 Years After the Quake: The Hope for Haiti
79.plot: We continue our journey in Haiti three years after the earthquake. This week we bring you updates on the two main reconstruction projects Tzu Chi is undertaking in Port Au Prince, the Kindergarten Durocher and the College Marie-Anne.

80.title: Haiti: Interview with the Secretary of State for External Cooperation
80.plot: With Robert Labrousse, Haiti's Secretary of State for External Cooperation, let's have a look back at the work that Tzu Chi has done since the earthquake until today and what the hope is for the future.

81.title: Jimmy Wu's Story, Part IV: The Door of Hope
81.plot: This last but not least episode of the story of Jimmy Wu finalizes the ending chapter of the heartwarming four part series.

82.title: Pick Up America: Stepping Forward, Part I
82.plot: Follow the Pick Up Artists as they arrive in San Francisco on the last year of their journey.

83.title: Pick Up America, Stepping Forward: Part 2
83.plot: Follow the pick up artists as they prepare for the final event to conclude their 3 year journey, "Stepping Forward Day."

84.title: Pick Up America: Stepping Forward, Part 3
84.plot: "Stepping Forward Day" and the final moments of PUA.

85.title: Sandy, 3 Months Later
85.plot: Three months after Hurricane Sandy, many affected residents still didn't receive help from their insurance companies or from the government.

86.title: Unconditional Love: Tiffany's Story
86.plot: Tiffany found out her unborn child would not be like most other children. It was in fact uncertain whether Carrie would even survive birth. Let's go see how the whole family overcame their difficulties.

87.title: Ongoing Challenges of French Nuclear Power
87.plot: France is the most nuclearized country in the world with 19 plants and 58 reactors. USTC 360 went to France to meet with both pro and anti-nuclear activists to understand more of the ongoing challenges there.

88.title: Land Without SONGS
88.plot: An 85-year-old grandma and a 13-year-old little girl from Southern California swear to take down an old and damaged nuclear power plant San Onofre Nuclear Generating Station, known as SONGS.

89.title: Cultivate Our Own Field of Blessings: Tiffany's Story
89.plot: In a previous episode, we met Carrie, a seven year old girl with Dwarfism. Let's go see how Carrie's parents help her attend her first school.

90.title: Building Bridges
90.plot: The Tzu Chi Foundation builds bridges in its local community and it's through art, writing, and reaching out to other organizations that tie our neighborhoods and societies more richly and deeply.

91.title: Sandy, the New Seeds of Hope
91.plot: Five months after Superstorm Sandy, the Tzu Chi Relief Program has transitioned to middle and long term efforts.

92.title: Water Minds Like Flowers
92.plot: The Tzu Chi Education Foundation has had a character education program for 6 years, supporting schools in low-income areas.

93.title: Believe, Achieve, Succeed
93.plot: The Barack Obama Male Leadership Academy has had a long partnership with the Dallas Tzu Chi Chapter, sharing one common goal: seeing students from low-income families succeed.

94.title: The BP Oil Spill, 3 Years Later: Part I
94.plot: Three years after the BP oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico, the Gulf's ecosystems and residents are still suffering. Let's join us on this episode to find out more about the recent updates on this largest accidental oil spill in the world.

95.title: BP Oil Spill, 3 Years Later: Part II
95.plot: Come with us as we met up with more fishermen to see how they are dealing with the consequences of the BP Oil Spill three years later.

96.title: Journey to the West
96.plot: A group of Tzu Chi volunteers has vowed to travel around the United States in order to place the Book of Jing Si Aphorisms in every hotel room. Will they be able to succeed?

97.title: The Grand Opening of Collège Marie-Anne
97.plot: Two different religions, two different organizations, two different countries, and volunteers from US, Canada, Taiwan and Haiti, are united for one thing, and one thing only, that's love.

98.title: BOMLA: One of a Kind
98.plot: We go back to the Barack Male Leadership Academy in Dallas, TX, this time, to learn more about the man who had the idea of redefining education for the youth in one of Dallas' poorest areas.

99.title: Cap Haitien Meets Port au Prince
99.plot: US Tzu Chi Volunteers travel to the two largest cities in Haiti, Cap Haitien and Port Au Prince. While there, they performed two Spring Blessing Ceremonies. They get updates about Hurricane Sandy Relief efforts and the Moringa Tree.

100.title: Behind the Scenes of US Tzu Chi 360
100.plot: Get a view behind the scenes of how US Tzu Chi 360 operates. You get to meet the filmmakers behind the cameras and talents responsible for the voices of the show.

101.title: Colorful Eating
101.plot: Many restaurants are looking at making their vegetarian options more flavorful and delicious, not only for health benefits but in consideration of societal improvement.

102.title: Haiti: Pulling Hope from the Rubble and Violence
102.plot: After the 2010 earthquake, gender based violence became the daily life for many women in the tent cities. Malya and her team at KOFAVIV are here to help them and fight this issue.

103.title: Learning Journey
103.plot: The educational philosophy in Tzu Chi's preschool is mainly focused on cultivating a habit of kindness and a habit of giving and helping others.

104.title: The Stone Camp: A Life Off the Grid
104.plot: Teddy and Kathy Carns are a couple who live up in the Southwest Pennsylvania Mountains at an isolated, off the grid dwelling named the "Stone Camp." Come find out exactly what they do in this latest episode.

105.title: Character Education in San Bernardino
105.plot: Tzu Chi's Character Education classes have been ongoing for 6 years, mentoring kids in the low income neighborhood of San Bernardino California.

106.title: Finding the Strength to Survive: Julie Lee's Story
106.plot: In 2012, Julie Lee was diagnosed with lymphoma, a blood cancer that affected not just her chest, but also her brain. We'll join Julie now to see what her journey was like, and how since she has found a stronger purpose to move forward.

107.title: Humanistic Bodhisattva: Peng Jen's Story
107.plot: In order to grow roots in a foreign country, 63-year-old Taiwanese immigrant Peng Jen Sia strongly overcame the obstacles of speaking English and daily driving in Los Angeles.

108.title: Believe in Faith
108.plot: Imagine a gift that sounds very lovely, but comes at the cost of something very precious. Watch to experience laughter and tears, and to find the unexpected.

109.title: Blossom of Hope
109.plot: This summer, our 360 team visited Houston, Texas, and met single mothers from Burma with differing educational backgrounds and big responsibilities.

110.title: Sandy, Beyond the Pictures
110.plot: Join our Community Outreach Associates and Tzu Chi volunteers to see how they are trying to reach out to those who are still affected by the storm, and to witness our very first furniture distribution.

111.title: Tzu Qin & Luca's Story
111.plot: In this week's episode, we spotlight two Tzu Chi volunteers, Tzu Qin and Luca Ye, from California.

112.title: Being Muslim in New York After 9/11
112.plot: After the events of September 11th 2001, the New York Muslim community was to face many challenges. In the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy, COPO teamed up with Tzu Chi to provide assistance to the NY Muslim community, which still struggled.

113.title: Finding Life's Path with Joe Huang
113.plot: Joe Huang was born in Taiwan and moved to the US when he was 13 years old, but in September 2010, he was to make a decision that would change the rest of his life: he would become one of Master Cheng Yen's disciples.

114.title: San Francisco: Happy Family, Part I
114.plot: Tzu Chi in San Francisco entered Hunter's Point and decided to help educate the children of Malcolm X only 3 years ago. However, they never stopped there.

115.title: San Francisco: Happy Family, Part II
115.plot: Tzu Chi entered Hunter's Point 3 years ago and have a final performance for the summer program. Although this is the end of year 3, volunteers look forward to the next year and to further see the growth of the Malcolm X students.

116.title: The Path of Destiny
116.plot: It's no surprise that Indianapolis is the home of the Indy 500 and that last year it was host to the 2012 Superbowl. But a fact much lesser known is that it's also home to over 7,000 Burmese refugees.

117.title: All for One
117.plot: This summer, the 360 team was introduced to the Burmese Community Center for Education's Neineh Plo, who took us around to the different gardens he works on as part of the organization's farming project.

118.title: Kary's Story
118.plot: Kary Kao lost just about everything in a fire that nearly took her life away. But, with the everlasting love and care from friends and from Tzu Chi, she's able to live again, facing herself bravely and with gratitude.

119.title: Superstorm Sandy: One Year Anniversary, Part I
119.plot: Last year's Superstorm Sandy permanently transformed lives, homes, and livelihoods in the metro area. But what's also permanently changed is our climate.

120.title: Superstorm Sandy, One Year Anniversary: Part II
120.plot: In the memorial of the anniversary of Hurricane Sandy, Tzu Chi New York Chapter had the privilege to participate in 2 memorial events.

121.title: The Best Partner: One Legacy
121.plot: The Tzu Chi Medical Foundation has had a long time partnership with an organization called One Legacy, which, to patients in need, provides donations of a different kind.

122.title: A Third World in the US
122.plot: The Eastern Coachella Valley, is an agricultural region in Southern California where the land is rich, but most of the people are not.

123.title: Modesto: Farmers in the Dust
123.plot: Though Modesto, California, may be popularly known as the hometown of Star Wars visionary George Lucas, Stanislaus County is also home to more than 18 million almond trees and over 1,600 orchards to contain them.

124.title: Fresno: Volunteering as a Family
124.plot: Join us as we travel to Fresno, California, where raisins and grapes are king.

125.title: Keeping Heads Above Water
125.plot: On September 9, 2013, Colorado got hit with its worst flood in over 100 years. 17 counties received heavy water damage and many of the survivors have struggled not only find a new place to stay, but also a way to wade through the contamination caused by the overturned oil wells and broken sewage containers. FEMA has been busy providing financial assistance to help the local people rebuild their lives but the scope of the disaster is too large for any single group's undertaking alone. Looking to join the relief efforts, Volunteers from the Tzu Chi Foundation as well as...

126.title: Everlasting Love
126.plot: When a loved one faces a severe illness, a close family member often decides to take care of them on their own. Join us in Houston as we meet a family that shows us what it means to go above and beyond.

127.title: The French Green Movement
127.plot: Over the years in France, a movement that involves organic agriculture, vegetarian or vegan cuisine has been booming. Let's go to the Paris Vegan Day and meet with the main activists of that French Green Movement.

128.title: Jing Si Aphorisms in Hotels
128.plot: Tzu Chi volunteers in the US decided to spread Jing Si Aphorisms books in 4 different languages in English/Spanish/Japanese/Chine­se, to an American audience.

129.title: Our Home, San Dimas
129.plot: This week 360 brings you to San Dimas California, the headquarters of all nine U.S. Tzu Chi chapters. As we celebrate the New Year, join us as we celebrate 25 years of Tzu Chi in the United States.

130.title: A Climate Change Journey
130.plot: The 19th United Nations Conference on Climate Change just ended in Warsaw, Poland, and many individuals, worldwide, are starting to be affected by climate change in their daily lives.

132.title: Homeless in the US: Hsu's Story
132.plot: While Tzu Chi volunteers stepped in to bring Hsu hope, love and care, Kendall Jackman and Arvernetta Henry from "Picture the Homeless" share the reality of what it's like to lose nearly everything in our golden years.

133.title: Surviving the Great Recession
133.plot: How did Tzu Chi survive the bad economic times and how did Tzu Chi volunteers inspire people to love and give despite the crisis?

134.title: Grandma's Christmas Gift
134.plot: This is a story about forgiveness and love. Let's see how Tzu Chi volunteers went through all the difficulties to contribute their love in Riverside, CA.

135.title: Our Home in the Big Apple
135.plot: Join us this week as we take you on a journey through special parts of the city to understand from who and how harmony is spreading across New York City.

136.title: Tzu Chi American Portraits
136.plot: In this episode, we share with you stories of everyday Americans who have decided to give back to their communities by becoming a Tzu Chi volunteer.

137.title: Character Counts
137.plot: Character Education is a type of teaching that is focused on helping children blossom into socially and morally healthy adults. Ideally parents are the ones to do this job at home - but how many actually do?

138.title: At Home in Cedar Grove
138.plot: Join us this week as we meet our friends here in New Jersey who show us what it means to be really dedicated to community service- and fresh veggies.

139.title: Re-Birthday
139.plot: Mr. Wong had been having dialysis treatment for quite some time. After a transplant, Tzu Chi volunteers took care of him and accompanied him on the lengthy path of recovery.

140.title: Disaster Relief: A Conversation with the American Red Cross and NYDIS
140.plot: Join us as we learn about that spirit from two very special guests from organizations that have paved the way not only for volunteerism, but also open dialogue, throughout our nation.

141.title: Tzu Ching: The Young and the Restless
141.plot: Today we introduce you to a special group of volunteers from across the country who subsist on a steady diet of pizza, ramen, all-nighters.

142.title: Women at the United Nations: Part I
142.plot: This week we're going to see the 58th Annual of the CSW conference, or the Commission on the Status of Women. This year they tackle this goal: gauging the roadblocks and successes for women in achieving the Millennium Development Goals.

143.title: Women at the United Nations: Part II
143.plot: This week we continue to find out more about United Nation's commission of the status of women as we attended the panels in the second week.

144.title: Tzu Chi USA's Origins
144.plot: Today we bring you all the way back to 1989, when Tzu Chi first took root in the US. Let's see how the mission to save the world started here- with shoulder pads and coke bottle glasses in full force.

145.title: Tzu Chi's Golden Volunteers
145.plot: Didn't think your gran or gramps had it in them to roll up their sleeves and volunteer? Join us today as we meet mature volunteers who give the Energizer Bunny some healthy competition.

146.title: Finding the Dharma, Behind Bars
146.plot: Join us this week as 360 sits down with Richard Baksa, a prison reformer who proves to inmates that the dharma is mightier than the sword.

147.title: Bathing the Buddha: A Tradition of Respect, Reflection, & Love
147.plot: Join us as this week as hosts Dilber Shatursun, Kevin Hsieh, Michael Chiu, and Nils Aucante show us how Tzu Chi celebrates mothers everywhere and the Buddha- all across the planet.

148.title: A Glance at Tzu Chi's Humanistic Culture
148.plot: Jean Jacques Rousseau said that to "see people as real and equal," we must "see the world through the lens of many types of vulnerability, cultivating a rich imagination." Today, we'll meet the people who might just be his reincarnation.

149.title: Our Home in Washington D.C
149.plot: In today's episode, we'll be trekking across the entire region from Virginia, across DC, and later Maryland to show you the hustle and bustle that happens thanks to Tzu Chi's Washington DC Regional Office.

150.title: Tzu Chi's History in Guatemala and the Dominican Republic
150.plot: After Hurricanes George and Mitch in 1998, Tzu Chi Volunteers went to Guatemala and the Dominican Republic for disaster relief. See how the seeds they planted then have grown and how they've blossomed into 2 schools.

151.title: Disaster, in the Heart of America
151.plot: This week, 360 travels to Kentucky & Illinois, where you can see the Appalachian Region in full bloom. But, don't be fooled by the regions' beauty- it's unassuming towns like these that can be most vulnerable to disaster.

152.title: Tzu Chi Cares
152.plot: TIMA is an organized global network of doctors and nurses who serve as volunteers. They spend so much time to participate in every Outreach. Join us this week as we find out why and how they do it, with compassion in mind.

153.title: The Power of Change
153.plot: Back in 1993, Alhambra, Los Angeles, the very first Tzu Chi clinic in the US started their medical mission to ensure proper care of the body, mind, and soul of the patient.

154.title: Chicago, Home Sweet Home
154.plot: Chicago, Illinois, holds the title for being the third most populous city in the US at 2.7 million residents and counting- so let's see what Tzu Chi is doing here through the Midwest Regional HQ to make a difference in the Windy City.

155.title: Coming Together for the Children
155.plot: Although a great school can work wonders for a child's development, even the best of public education is unable to completely fulfill all its student's needs.

imdb.title: US Tzu Chi 360
plot: _US Tzu Chi 360_ (qv), produced by Tzu Chi USA's Media Center, tells the stories of US Tzu Chi volunteers' efforts in humanitarian aid in the United States, Latin America, and beyond.::Ting Fan
synopsis: US Tzu Chi 360 tells the stories of US Tzu Chi volunteers' efforts in the United States as well as their quest to provide international relief.
